summary: CLAUDE.md testing and checkpoint automation setup

message.content: Test the debug system. Create a small intentional bug in a test file, then use debug-orchestrator to fix it. Save results via /checkpoint. Enable /auto mode.

summary: CLI setup, dependency fixes, test suite fixed

content.text:
I'll test the debug system by creating an intentional bug, using debug-orchestrator to fix it, and then saving results via /checkpoint in autonomous mode.

Let me start by enabling /auto mode and creating a test scenario.

content.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Debug Orchestrator - Intelligent debugging with regression detection and self-healing
# Solves the problem: "fixing one thing breaks another"

set -eo pipefail

CLAUDE_DIR="${HOME}/.claude"
DEBUG_DIR="${CLAUDE_DIR}/.debug"
BUG_FIX_MEMORY="${DEBUG_DIR}/bug-fixes.jsonl"
REGRESSION_LOG="${DEBUG_DIR}/regressions.jsonl"
TEST_SNAPSHOTS="${DEBUG_DIR}/test-snapshots"
LOG_FILE="${CLAUDE_DIR}/debug-orchestrator.log"

# GitHub MCP integration - detect if MCP server is available
if type -t mcp__grep__searchGitHub &>/dev/null; then
    GITHUB_MCP_AVAILABLE=true
else
    GITHUB_MCP_AVAILABLE=false
fi

CHROME_MCP_AVAILABLE=false

mkdir -p "$DEBUG_DIR" "$TEST_SNAPSHOTS"

log() {
    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] $1" >> "$LOG_FILE"
}

# =============================================================================
# BUG FIX MEMORY BANK
# =============================================================================

record_bug_fix() {
    local bug_description="$1"
    local bug_type="$2"
    local fix_description="$3"
    local files_changed="$4"
    local success="$5"
    local tests_passed="${6:-unknown}"

    local record
    record=$(jq -n \
        --arg desc "$bug_description" \
        --arg type "$bug_type" \
        --arg fix "$fix_description" \
        --arg files "$files_changed" \
        --arg success "$success" \
        --arg tests "$tests_passed" \
        --arg ts "$(date -u +%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ)" \
        '{

toolUseResult.stdout:
#!/bin/bash
# Debug Orchestrator - Intelligent debugging with regression detection and self-healing
# Solves the problem: "fixing one thing breaks another"

set -eo pipefail

CLAUDE_DIR="${HOME}/.claude"
DEBUG_DIR="${CLAUDE_DIR}/.debug"
BUG_FIX_MEMORY="${DEBUG_DIR}/bug-fixes.jsonl"
REGRESSION_LOG="${DEBUG_DIR}/regressions.jsonl"
TEST_SNAPSHOTS="${DEBUG_DIR}/test-snapshots"
LOG_FILE="${CLAUDE_DIR}/debug-orchestrator.log"

# GitHub MCP integration - detect if MCP server is available
if type -t mcp__grep__searchGitHub &>/dev/null; then
    GITHUB_MCP_AVAILABLE=true
else
    GITHUB_MCP_AVAILABLE=false
fi

CHROME_MCP_AVAILABLE=false

mkdir -p "$DEBUG_DIR" "$TEST_SNAPSHOTS"

log() {
    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] $1" >> "$LOG_FILE"
}

# =============================================================================
# BUG FIX MEMORY BANK
# =============================================================================

record_bug_fix() {
    local bug_description="$1"
    local bug_type="$2"
    local fix_description="$3"
    local files_changed="$4"
    local success="$5"
    local tests_passed="${6:-unknown}"

    local record
    record=$(jq -n \
        --arg desc "$bug_description" \
        --arg type "$bug_type" \
        --arg fix "$fix_description" \
        --arg files "$files_changed" \
        --arg success "$success" \
        --arg tests "$tests_passed" \
        --arg ts "$(date -u +%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ)" \
        '{
